artifact_name: figure(aryballos ? in form of bull's head)
Object Type: figure (aryballos ? in form of bull's head)
Description: Glazed composition head of a bull with sunk depressions for inlaid eyes. Eyes outlined by double incised line. Incised decoration in regular lines to indicate dew-lap, running down either side of head, and five lines centrally incised along back of neck which come up between horns and end in looped tongue-shape. Small projecting muzzle with nostrils and mouth cut out. Behind head the neck is hollowed out and shows some traces of a wound bundle of grass-like material. Possibly an oil/ointment container like the aryballoi of sixth century date?. Object broken because wall becomes very thin on right side. Glaze all gone, some trace of green colour remains. Core fine, medium hard creamy white.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ5 (top level of 'bothros' / 'trench with bowls'), probably
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. I, no. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FD.03)
